loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Hin, age 48, makes a living by selling fish in a local market of Baray district. She is married and has 4 children, three of whom are living under the same roof as her. The fish she sells are caught by her husband from the nearby river called Tonle Sap. 

Hin is taking out a loan to purchase fishing materials for her husband such as a new boat with a motor and fishing materials. For her prospect, she hopes to rebuild a stronger house to provide comfortable living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat with a motor and fishing materials.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 27 years old, married, and blessed with one child. He owns a general shop in the Baba Dogo area. He has been in this business for the last ten years and gets an income of KES.18,000 per month.

He has good credit history with KADET LTD and is applying for his third loan of KES.80,000 from them, which he plans use to buy stock like sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, and flour. He will use the extra profit to expand his business.

He hopes to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy stock like sugar, soap, cooking oil, and flour

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, 29 years old, has been operating a retail shop to earn a living for eight years and employs one person. He also farms to earn extra income. Moses describes his business environment as competitive because many people are involved in the same activity.

Since joining Faulu Kenya, Moses has been able to improve his business and hopes to expand his shop into a wholesale operation in the future. He is now requesting a 40,000 Kenya Shillings loan to buy maize, beans and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a fifty-four-year-old lady. She is single and a mother of one child. She owns a catering and poultry business. Mary has been in the business for four years now and gets a monthly income of one hundred and sixty thousand shillings. 

This will be Jane’s first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy another oven for efficiency. With the profit that she will get, she wants to buy more broilers (chicken) for layers (egg producers). 

In the future, she wants to be able to invest more in the chicken farming and catering business.

loans.use: To buy another oven

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a 31-year-old married woman from Al Hussien, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Nisreen has a home-based beauty salon and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase equipment needed for her salon. Nisreen is looking to purchase a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed for her home-based beauty salon

loans.name: Vahanush

texts.en: Vahanush, 61 years old, lives in Shikahogh village with his pensioner wife. He works at the Shikahogh preserve and is also involved in cattle breeding. Vahanush has applied for this loan to buy three additional cows, a purchase that will help increase his income from agriculture and thereby enable the couple to meet living costs and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 43-year-old married man from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a father of three children. He has a "sarvees" ( a means of transportation like a taxi but more than one person can use it at once) and he is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to do maintenance on it.

Ali is looking to purchase a new "sarvees" so that he can increase his income and purchase his dream house.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his "sarvees"

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a  conservative person and she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet so the man in the photo is her husband.

Taghreed is a 32-year-old married woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a mother of one child. She sells clothes. She works from her house and is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more clothing for business purposes.

Taghreed is looking to increase her sales volume and purchase a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 42 years old, married with 5 children. He sells milk to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and describes his business environment as busy because he has many regular customers who visit him daily. To earn extra income, he sells chickens. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 25,000 Kenya Shillings to buy milk for sale.

loans.use: To buy milk for sale

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a 53-year-old married woman from Al Hussien, Amman, Jordan and a mother of one child. She paints on glass, and she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to purchase materials needed for her business.

Hanaa is looking to increase her family's income and improve their life.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for painting on glass

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 30 years old. He is from Naivasha and is married to Hannah. They do not have children yet.

Michael has a motorcycle that he has been running for the past three years. He has applied for his first loan to enable him to buy another motorbike so that he can meet the demand of his customers.

He hopes to venture into a minibus transport business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is 30 years old. He sells used clothes to earn a living. He has been in the business for 11 years and has employed three people. He describes his customers as low income earners because they live in slums. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business and hopes to own a boutique in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy used clothes for sale.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes for sale

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 32-year-old married woman from Al Hussien, Amman, Jordan. She is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Sanaa sells home products, and she is requesting a loan of 700 JD to purchase more quantities for business purposes. Sanaa is looking to expand her business and establish a shop for her products.

loans.use: to purchase home products for business purposes

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 53 years old and is married with three children who are all currently going to school.

He plans to use this loan to purchase various farm inputs he needs to expand his farming, specifically, manure, fertilizer, pesticides and labor.  

Joshua hopes that the increased profits from this loan will enable him to implement an irrigation system so he will no longer be so dependent on the rain.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men, a 46-year-old responsible mother of five children, resides in Baray district of Kompong Tom province where she has been cultivating rice to generate household income for 12 years. She is now requesting a loan to hire people to prepare the land, pay for plowing fees and purchase seeds and fertilizers. Men hopes that she can build a strong family and someday uplift it from poverty .

loans.use: to hire people to prepare the land, pay for plowing fees and purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products to supply her store and also to buy materials to repair the roof and floor of her business

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
Don Félix es una persona muy trabajadora dedicado su negocio vive  actualmente con su esposa y sus tres hijos en Choluteca Honduras.
Don Félix su  negocio  es la  venta de refrescos, jugos naturales y pan actividad que realiza en las plantaciones  de  melón, sandia  y  caña de  azúcar desde hace  mas de 10 años.
Don Félix el préstamo lo necesita para la compra azúcar, frutas como tamarindos, naranjas y  bolsa plástica  de  empaque.
Don Félix esta esperando que mejore su actividad con capital para satisfacer  las  necesidades de sus clientes.
Los planes a futuro de Don Félix son comprar un vehículo para salir a vender a otras fincas mas retiradas de distancia y ayudar a su familia para salir adelante. 


Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Don Félix is a very hardworking person who is dedicated to his business. He currently lives with his wife and three children in Choluteca, Honduras. He has been selling beverages, natural juices and bread on watermelon and sugar cane plantations for more than 10 years.

Don Félix needs a loan to purchase sugar, fruit such as tamarinds and oranges and plastic bags. He is hoping to use capital to improve his business so that he can satisfy his customers’ needs. His future plans are to buy a vehicle so that he can travel further to sell on more distant  farms and help his family move forward.

Choluteca, Honduras – March, 2012

loans.use: to purchase sugar, fruit such as tamarinds and oranges and plastic bags  for his business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old man from Baqa'a, Jordan. He has a small cafeteria and is requesting a loan of 800 JD to expand his business and purchase materials needed for his cafeteria.

Mohammad is looking to improve his income and raise his family's living standard by providing them with better living conditions. Because Mohammad is under 30 years old, his loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to expand his business and purchase materials needed for his  cafeteria

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for four years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children. All of them are still in school. 

Josephine heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 47-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children. She sells different types of goods: clothes, blankets and many others.

Nawal is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more goods for business purposes. She dreams of purchasing a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods for business purposes ( clothes, blankets, etc.)

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a coservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man  in the photo is her son.

Wafaa is looking to improve her family's living  conditions so she is requesting a loan of 700 JD to do maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en:
Bashar is a 32-year-old man from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Bashar is about to get married so he is requesting a loan of 1200 JD to cover part of his wedding expenses.

loans.use: to cover part of his wedding expenses

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a 38-year-old single lady from Baqa'a, Jordan. Taghreed has a home-based project; she sells blankets and clothes.
 
Taghreed is looking to purchase more blankets and clothing for business purposes. She wants to increase her capital to improve her business and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and blankets for business purposes

loans.name: Yaseen

texts.en:
Yaseen is a 35-year-old man with two children. He works hard to offer his family the best. For this reason, he has been operating all day in his grocery store. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. 

He works an average of 13 hours per day. During this time, he tends to his customers, who all live nearby. He believes that his business is a success because he always offers the lowest possible prices. He knows that good prices are a crucial aspect of customers' purchase decisions.

He applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to be able to buy new freezer and beans, soft drinks, etc. This will allow him to improve the way in which he displays the products in his store. He knows that this investment will mean that his customers will be better able to see his products. With the new income from this investment, he hopes to have a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy new freezer and beans, soft drinks, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for four years. She is 32 years old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, who lives in Yei, has been operating a food stall for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school. Mary learned about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and is now requesting her second loan for 1000 Sudanese pounds to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell. She will use the extra resulting income to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Elsi Noemi

texts.es:
La señora Elsi tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, uno de 15 años de edad y el otro de 12. Desde hace seis años que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan dulce y pan francés, esta actividad la aprendió de su esposo ya que es panadero. El pan que elabora lo vende en  su casa y su esposo sale a vender en una bicicleta en la colonia donde ellos viven y lugares aledaños a la zona.

Elsi compra los insumos para la elaboración del pan a los distribuidores, que se encargan de llevar los insumos hasta su casa, ya que ellos no cuentan con los recursos necesarios para el traslado de los mismos. Cuando se les terminan los insumos solo llaman para realizar el pedido al crédito y al final de la semana lo cancelan.

La señora Elsi solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 50 cartones de huevos, 25 quintales de harina de pan, 25  quintales de azúcar, 30 libras de manteca, 20 libras de sal, una carretada de leña y para mejorar el horno ya que esta dañado.

Con la inversión podrá elaborar pan de diferentes clases, venderá más y sus ingresos aumentaran de esta manera podrá satisfacer la demanda existente en la zona. Ella desea comprar un horno industrial que funcione con energía eléctrica para hornear más pan, debido a que en invierno solo puede hornear una vez al día por la lluvia en cambio al comprar el horno industrial podrá hornear dos veces al día puesto que el horno estará dentro de la casa. También quiere construir una habitación ya que tiene dos hijos adolescentes que necesitan su propio espacio.
texts.en:
Elsi is 34 years old. She is married, with two children. One is 15 years old and the other is 12 years old. For the last six years she has been making and selling fresh bread including French bread. She learned this activity from her husband who is a baker. The bread that she makes she sells at home and her husband sells it from a bicycle in the neighborhood where they live and in the surrounding areas.

Elsi buys the supplies to make the bread from distributors, who carry the supplies to her home since they lack the necessary resources to transport them. When they run out of supplies she calls and places her order by credit, and then she pays for it at the end of the week. 

Elsi is asking for a loan from Fundación Campo, in order to buy 50 cartons of eggs, 25 quintals of flour, 25 quintals of sugar, 30 pounds of butter, 20 pounds of salt, a cartload of wood, and to make improvements to the stove which is damaged.

With the investment she can make different types of bread, she will be able to sell more and her income will increase and in this way she can satisfy the neighborhood demand. 

Her dream is to buy an industrial electric stove to bake more bread, because in the winter she can only bake once a day because of the rain. On the other hand, upon buying an industrial stove she could bake two times a day since the stove would be inside the house. Also she wants to construct a room because her two teenage children need their own space.

loans.use: to buy 50 cartons of eggs, 25 quintals of flour, 25 quintals of sugar, 30 pounds of butter, 20 pounds of salt, a cartload of wood and she will make improvements to the stove that is damaged

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a very hard-working person who is always looking to provide a better life for his family. He is 33 years old and a father of three children who live together in Ibb, Yemen. Formerly, he worked at a mechanic workshop. He didn’t even earn enough to cover household expenses. 

To earn more money, he has started to work independently, selling spare parts. He has been running his business for six years. He hopes in this way to support his family and provide his children with a better standard of living. 

Eager to get his business going, he is hoping for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to stock his business with spare parts.
 
Mohammed hopes that his business will carry on doing well and he can offer very good products to his customers. As well, he hopes that with his earnings he can provide his family with a better quality of life and a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Yei. She sells food at a stall and has been in business for four years. She is 34 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are still in school. 

Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. Sarah is 35 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are still in school. 

Sarah heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. Sarah will use the extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. Abiba is 30 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Abiba heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. Abiba will use the extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: Enas

texts.en:
Enas is a 31-year-old married woman from Idon, Irbid, Jordan.

Enas is a conservative person, so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Enas is looking to improve her family life conditions, so she is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase new furniture for her house.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture for her house.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for two years. She is 25 years old, married, and has two children, all of whom are still in school. 

Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. Rose will use the extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Jacklin

texts.en: Jacklin lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for four years. She is 28 year old, married, and has four children. All of them are still in school. Jacklin heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Rexy

texts.en:
Rexy is engaged in a retail business where she offers salt and fish sauce. She is thankful because for almost six years of involvement in this kind of business, she has been able to generate an income of 3,200 Philippine pesos monthly. Her income is utilized in daily needs, allowances for her three children, and payment of the monthly electric bill.

Rexy is a responsible and loving mother to her three children. She has been doing her best in order to sustain their daily needs and to educate all her children. According to her, "the greatest accomplishment in life is to let our children finish their degrees and have their own best opportunities in life." Rexy knows that her sacrifices will have a fruitful outcome.

Rexy would like to take out a loan amounting to 10,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to stock salt and fish sauce for her retail business. She hopes to gain more profit, enabling her to maintain her business and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to stock salt and fish sauce for her retail business

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
In Kompong Cham Province, where the population is high, 70–80 percent of people prefer to work in agricultural businesses, especially those involving crops and livestock husbandry. Im, age 28, one of the inhabitants there, devotes her time to rice farming. She has been engaged in this type of business for many years. She is married and has two school-age children.

The purpose of this loan is to buy farming supplies and fertilizers in order to obtain a good harvest. And this will help to maintain the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizers in order to obtain a good harvest

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel, de 48 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de alegre y amable.  Está separada del padre de sus 2 hijos Richard de 26 y Melina de 22 años de edad por quienes se ha esforzado en salir adelante. Vive en compañía de sus hijas, instaladas cómodamente en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene Ysabel es la venta de comidas, como juanes, pescados asados, tamales y otros,  que lo realiza de lunes a viernes por las noches, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes logrando tener una buena acogida y demanda, instalándose en el frontis de su casa con una mesa y algunas sillas. 
Realiza éste negocio desde hace 10 años contando con la ayuda de su hermana, iniciándose con un capital de un préstamo familiar. Considera rentable a su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja, pues logra vender todo los que prepara a diario gracias a la acogida que tiene con sus clientes.
Le gusta cocinar aprendiendo de su made los secretos para una buena sazón, así como el ingreso económico que le permite pagar sus cuentas y gastos de su hogar. No le gusta el cansancio físico ya que tienen que levantarse muy de temprano por las mañanas para realizar los preparativos del día, pero eso no la desanima y continúa en su negocio.
Por eso desea ampliar su negocio y mejorar su techado donde pueda atender más cómodamente a sus clientes. Este será el préstamo número 14 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además dice estar cómoda con su grupo solidario que considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 4000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en el arreglo de su piso, como también en la compra de mesas, sillas y utensilios de cocina para renovar  sus enseres, de esa manera espera tener mayor acogida de sus clientes. Además de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de comidas como arroz, aceites, fideos y otros, buscando pecios bajos.
texts.en:
Ysabel, age 48, is a hard-working and diligent woman.  She is also cheerful and kind.  She is separated from the father of her two children, 26 year old Richard and 22 year old Melina.  It is for them that she has worked hard to get ahead.  She lives comfortably with her children in her own house.

Ysabel’s business is selling food like “juanes”, (similar to tamales, except made with rice and stuffed with fish, chicken, or yucca), grilled fish, tamales, and others.  She does this Monday through Friday at night.  She tends to her customers in a kind way.  She has managed to have her business be well-received and in demand.  She sets up in the front of her house with a table and some chairs.

She has had this business for ten years, and she counts on her sister’s help.  She started with money from a loan that a relative gave her.  She considers her business to be profitable because of the good income it gives her.  She manages to sell everything she prepares daily.  This is thanks to how well-received her business is with her customers.

She likes to cook, and she learned the secrets of good seasoning from her mother.  Her income allows her to pay her bills and her household expenses.  She does now like being physically tired.  She has to get up very early in the morning to make the daily preparations.  However, this does not discourage her, and she continues with her business.  She wishes to expand her business and to improve her roof, where she will be able to tend to her customers more comfortably.

This will be her 14th loan with MFP.  She is hoping for your collaboration in order to be able to firm up her plans.  Also, she says that she is comfortable with her communal bank, and she considers the members to be responsible people.  She will use the requested 4,000 soles to fix her floor.  She will also buy tables, chairs, and kitchen utensils in order to renovate her equipment.  This way she hopes to be more popular with her customers.  She will also buy the ingredients she needs to prepare the food.  She will buy things like rice, oil, noodles, and others, and she will be looking for low prices.

loans.use: to fix the floor; to buy tables, chairs and utensils, and to buy rice, oil, and noodles.

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Fatimah is a conservative person and she is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet. The man in the photo is her son.

Fatimah is a 55-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Amman, Jordan, and the mother of seven children.

Fatimah is looking to improve her family's life conditions, so she is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to paint her house.

loans.use: to paint her house.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen is from Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is 56 years old and married. Pen has been blessed with six children. She earns a livelihood and supports her family by farming crops. She grows rice and vegetables on the existing farm alongside her husband. She can earn an average of 2.50 USD per day.

Pen would like to borrow a loan to purchase rice seeds, mineral fertilizers and pesticides in order to start growing rice early in the coming rainy season this year. This loan will enable Pen to manage her business well. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, mineral fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Norly

texts.en:
Norly operates a cell-phone accessory stall. He has been involved in this kind of business for almost five years. He is 24 years of age and still single.

Norly would like to ask for financial assistance amounting to 10,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to buy more cellphone accessories for his stall. He believes that he could increase his income to be able to cover his family's needs and become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy more cellphone accessories

loans.name: Sonny

texts.en:
Sonny is 41 years old, married, and has two children. His eldest son is a high-school student, and his youngest is still an infant. He really appreciates his wife's efforts in order to earn a living.

Sonny has a restaurant business. His restaurant location is in the public market of Santiago. According to him, their main source of income comes primarily from their restaurant. Sonny needs to double his patience in running his business in order to obtain greater profit for his family's needs. His income goes to their daily expenses, allowance for his child, the basic needs of his infant, and rent for the restaurant. So his income is no longer enough to buy ingredients, raw pork, vegetables, and fish. For this reason, he is asking for a loan amounting to 20,000 Philippine pesos. He hopes that his requested loan amount will be granted so that he can improve his restaurant and satisfy his customers' demand. In this way, he could encourage more customers to eat in his restaurant, and, most of all, he could obtain more profits to save for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, raw pork, vegetables, and fish for his restaurant

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina lives in Yei. She sells clothes and has been in business for four years. She is 40 years old, married, and has six children, five of whom are still in school. 

Selina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Manino

texts.en:
Manino lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are still in school.

Manino heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Yara

texts.en:
Yara is a 31-year-old woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan.

Yara trades in blankets and she is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to purchase more quantities.

Yara is looking to improve her life conditions and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase blankets for trading purposes.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives in Yei. She sells  at a food stall and has been in business for five years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Catherine heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 30 year old, married, and has two children; both of them are still in school. 

Margret heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Mwanzo Group

texts.en:
Nuru is in her late 20s and is married with two children who go to school. She has been running a food cafe for three years now. Nuru works from 5:00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy empty crates of sodas and a fridge. Nuru has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to open a retail shop for selling food like sugar, wheat flour, baking flour, beans, and salt. Her dream is to open a salon.

She will share this loan with her "Mwanzo" loan group, which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to open a retail shop for selling food like sugar, wheat flour, baking flour, beans, and salt.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells at a food stall and has been in business for four years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Yei. She sells clothes and has been in business for four years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Margret heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 SDG in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 43 years old, married, and has six children; four of them are still in school. 

Christine heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Serap's Group

texts.en:
Serap is 32 years old and was born in Eskisehir. She is one of those ladies who started working as soon as she had completed her education. As a matter of fact, she had been working while studying on order to contribute to her family’s budget. Since she had devoted all her life to working, she had postponed the idea of marriage and only recently became engaged. As an eagerly devoted business woman following her graduation, she started working in the printing shop of her uncle without knowing anything about the business. Due to her eagerness and perseverance within a short time, she mastered the printing business. In time, when her uncle started a new business, he turned over the management and ownership of the printing house to Serap. Naturally she had some financial difficulties in the beginning and she still has, but she overcomes these difficulties with the support of Maya. She developed her business of the printing shop into the organization business, started entering into areas such as wedding invitations, and wedding candies.  Currently she has very good customer connections. She will use the current loan from Maya via Kiva to buy paper and edge cutting machines, and stamps. These machines will help her to decrease her costs by keeping certain jobs in house which she had been previously outsourcing, thus increasing her profit.  She always expresses her gratitude to Maya for their support.
 
The two other members of the group are marketing the products of a cleaning company both from home and from the store (with the support of Serap). They are thankful for the Maya loans, which provide them with working capital that enables them to buy products in bigger wholesale lots. 


Translated from Turkish by Maya Volunteers

Serap ,27/07/1979 Eskişehir doğumlu.Serap Hanım, eğitimini bitirir bitirmez iş hayatına atılan kadınlardan biri.Aslında eğitimi devam ederken de çeşitli yerlerde çalışmış ve ailesinin bütçesine katkıda bulunmuş.Hayatını çalışmaya adayan Serap Hanım, hayatında bir eş edinmeyi bile hep ertelediği için bu sene nişanlanabilmiş.Hayatını  önce iş kurmaya adamış,okulunu bitirdikten sonra eniştesinin matbasında hiç bilmediği bir işe başlamış ,başlangıçta konuyla ilgili hiçbirşey bilmiyormuş fakat o kadar azimle ve istekle işine sarılmış ki kısa zamanda bu işin erbabı olmuş sonrasında zamanın bir hediyesi olarak düşündüğü bir süreçte eniştesi başka bir alanda işe başlayınca matbasını serap hanım devralmış ilk dönem tabiki biraz maddi sıkıntıları olmuş halende bazı sıkıntıları olmaya devam ediyor ve bunu mayanın desteği ile kapatıyor.Matbaa işini büyüterek organizasyon işi ve düğün davetiyesi,nikah şekeri gibi alanlarada girmeye başlamış.Şu an Serap Hanım, çok iyi bir iş çevresine sahip bizden son çektiği kredisiyle kağıt kesme makinası ve köşe kesme aparatı ,kaşe alımı yapıcak böylelikle dışarıya parayla yaptırdığı bu işleri dükkanında kendi yaparak maliyetini fazlasıyla düşürüp kar yapacak.Maya’ya her zaman için desteklerinden dolayı minnet duygusunu dile getiriyor.
  Diğer kalan 2 grup üyesi ise bir temizlik firmasının ürünlerinin pazarlamasını hem evden hemde serap hanımın desteğiyle dükkandan yapabiliyorlar,çekilen krediyle toplu bir şekilde mal getirmek ellerinde sürekli sermaya bulunmasının Maya’nın sayesinde olduğunu dile getirip teşekkür ediyorlar.

loans.use: to buy paper and edge cutting machines, and stamps

loans.name: Maricho

texts.en:
Maricho is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maricho is 38 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are in school.

Maricho has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.

Maricho has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a conservative woman and she is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Ghada is 47 years old. She does embroidery from her house. 

Ghada is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase materials needed for her business.

Ghada is looking to increase her income and improve her family's life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery materials.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang is a 55-year-old married woman who permanently lives with her husband and 3 single children in Kompong Cham province. She is a farmer who has been in rice farming with almost 30 years of experience. Her husband helps her in this project. 

With a first loan, she plans to pay for rented land, plowing, and to purchase items such as bean seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to enhance her business. Her profit will be used to support her future business and her living. She dreams of having a good standard of living and providing her children a further education as her legacy.

loans.use: to pay for rented land, plowing, and to purchase items such as bean seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Tropia Group

texts.en:
Simon is in his late 20s and is married with three children, one of whom goes to school. Simon has been selling chips for two and a half years now. He works from 8.00 am to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants to use the loan to start selling traditional chicken. His dream is to one day be able to own a shop for spare car parts.

He will share this loan with his "Tropia" loan group, which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to start selling traditional chicken.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en:
Aramayis is a 48-year-old farmer from Armash village. Aramayis lives with his 41-year-old wife and 21-year-old son. The family runs a farm, where they grow trees, cultivate land and breed cattle. Aramayis would like to develop cattle breeding, for which he has applied for this loan. With the requested amount he will purchase a cow, hens and pigs. Aramayis also plans to renovate the barn and create favorable conditions for the cattle. 
Aramayis dreams of having a big farm with different types of agricultural fields. This loan will help him to start development of the farm and make his dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, hens and pigs

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.en: For his 14th loan, Zosimo has requested PHP 18,000, with which he intends to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell at his food stall. This business was previously funded through KIVA partners and NWTF. These loans continue to provide Zosimo and his family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Logina

texts.en:
Logina is 42 years old and married with 6 children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Logina is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Logina has been raising livestock for 25 years and also earns additional income from fishing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Ruby has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from raising hogs.

Ruby aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sarah Jean

texts.en:
Sarah Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

Sarah Jean has been in this business for 4 years. She earns additional income from fish vending.

Sarah Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Analiza

texts.en:
Maria Analiza is 44 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a jewelry and watch retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Maria Analiza has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the jewelry and watch retail business for 4 years and also earns an income from direct-selling Avon products.

Maria Analiza aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of jewelry to sell

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a bakery in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery.

Melisa has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from farming rice and a general store.

Melisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives in Yei. She sells food at a stall, and has been in business for two years. She is 25 years old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Stella heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Madelene

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Madelene works hard to support her family. She has a rice retail business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling soft drinks and beer. Madelene is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Madelene has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of rice to sell

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia lives in Yei. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 40 year old, married, and has six children. Three of them are still in school. 

Cicilia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Yamah

texts.en: Yamah is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children between the ages 12 and 20. She lives in Air Port area along with her children and husband. Her children are in school. For 20 years now, she has been selling bread. She learned how to sell from her mother. She enjoys her business because the business gives her money every day. Yamah requested a loan to buy more flour, sugar, butter, and other item for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, butter, and other item for her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Convive con Elmer quien se dedica al transporte, fruto de ésta unión tienen 2 hermosos hijos Deysi de 13 y Flor de 6  años de edad a quienes quiere mucho. Juntos habitan cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Rosa es la venta de helados de frutas, contando con una refrigeradora. Uan vez listos son llevados al colegio pues tiene un pequeño puesto en el cafetin y desde ahí atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes que son los estudiantes y docentes. Se inicio  desde  hace más de 4 años y hasta el momento lo realiza ella sola.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene sus productos por el clima caluroso de la zona. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y las necesidades de sus pequeños hijos quienes son la motivación para seguir progresando, por lo contrario no le gusta cuando llueve muy seguido bajando las ventas y reduciendo sus ganancias pero aun así logra ser rentable. Por tanto tiene planes de seguir y mantenerlo, ampliando su capacidad de stock disponible. Este será el préstamo número 1 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para seguir con su negocio y avanzar con sus planes. Por otro lado comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues  considera a sus miembros ser buenas personas y cumplidos. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de helados y en la compra de bebidas refrescantes a precio por mayor para así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa, 31 years old is a hardworking woman who is eager to get ahead. She lives with Elmer, who works in transportation, and they have two beautiful children, Deysi, 13 and Flor, 5, whom they love very much. They live comfortably in their own house.

Rosa has a business selling fruit ices from a refrigerator. Once they are ready, she takes them to school where she has a small stand in the cafeteria. From there she cordially serves her customers, who are students and teachers. She started this business over four years ago and during that time she has worked alone.

She considers her business very profitable because of the demand for her products due to the hot climate in the area. She likes her business since it enables her to have an income with which she can pay for household expenses and the needs of her small children who motivate her to continue moving forward. She does not like it when it rains very frequently, thereby lowing sales and reducing profits but even then the business still manages to be profitable. Therefore she plans to continue it by increasing her available inventory. This will be her first loan with MFP. She is grateful for the financial help to continue with her business and to move forward with her plans.

She is also pleased with her communal bank since she considers its members to be good and committed people. With the sum of S/. 1,000 requested, she will purchase the ingredients to prepare frozen ices and also buy soft drinks wholesale so she will have greater profits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, various kinds of fruit,  to make frozen ices, as well as soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena produces palm kennel oil for sale, she has been in this business for 10 years now. She lives together with her husband who is a electrician and 6 dependents. Helena uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility bills.  Helena will use her loan to purchase palm kennel and palm fruit the produce the oil for sale. With the new profit, she wants to buy a machine for the production of her oil.

loans.use: purchase palm kennel and palm fruit the produce the oil for sale.

loans.name: Partritia

texts.en: Partritia is a petty trader at Kajebil near Takoradi. She trades in vegetables such as tomatoes, garden eggs (a type of eggplant also known as a "mock tomato"), onions, peppers, and other food items. She is also a fishmonger. Partritia is married so she uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills.  Partritia will use her loan to  purchase more vegetables and food items to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more vegetables and food items to sell

loans.name: Chernor's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are primary school teachers from the village of Magbass, in Northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan in order to solve their immediate financial challenges – some will use their share of the loan to buy a piece of land, others to build a family dwelling, and some will invest in a business, pay school fees for their children, etc. And at the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Chernor is the leader of this group of teachers. The 49-year-old is a native of Magbass village. He is married to a housewife, and the couple has seven children, all of whom are in school. Chernor has been a professional teacher for 25 years now. With his share of this loan, he is going to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad grows peas on his farm in Gaza. He received his loan to build a fence around his land in order to protect his crops and prevent theft.  Ahmad is 29 years old and has been working in farming for his whole adult life. His future plans are to improve the efficiency of his farm and increase his output.

loans.use: to build a fence around his farm

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 27 years old and married with 2 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Riza has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Riza has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Kokoo M.

texts.en: Kokoo has three children aged between 17 and 24; two of them attend school. She is married and a high school graduate. Her husband works with Firestone. For the past six years, she has been selling rice, peppers, bitter ball, and other items on her table at the local market. She is asking for a loan to purchase rice, peppers, bitter ball, and other items to expand her market table. Her plans are to send her children on to higher education.

loans.use: to purchase rice, peppers, bitter ball, and others items to expand her market table.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Yei. She sells at a food stall and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children. Two of them are still in school. 

Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase cassava flour and maize. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour and maize for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 50 years old, is married, and has five children. She does dairy farming to earn a living. She has been in business for five years and has employed one person. To earn extra income, she sells secondhand clothes. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy two dairy cows and animal feed.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows and animal feed.

loans.name: Calvin

texts.en:
Calvin is 34 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 3 years, Calvin has been working hard to manage her small business, selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Calvin has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and it will help Calvin to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Calvin hopes that in the future she will be able to earn more money to expand her business.

Calvin is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Calvin who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a petty trader at Kajebil near Takoradi. She trades in vegetables such as tomatoes, garden eggs (a type of African eggplant), onions, peppers, and food items such as cooking oil, eggs, and groundnuts. Esther is married to a farmer and has 2 children. She uses her income to assist her husband with paying their children’s school fees. Esther will use her loan to  purchase more vegetables and food items to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and food items to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells at a food stall and has been in business for five years. She is 40 years old, widowed, and has seven children, two of whom are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en: Theresah lives with her husband and 1 child in Kajebil near Takoradi. Her husband works with Cocobord. Theresah is a petty trader, selling vegetables such as tomatoes, garden eggs (a type of African eggplant), onions, peppers, and other foodstuffs. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. Theresah will use her loan to purchase more vegetables and foodstuffs to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Tugirubukire A / Rbv Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Jean Pierre est agriculteur des pommes de terre. Il fait partie du groupe TUGIRUBUKIRE A / Rbv. Il a 31 ans, marié et a 2 enfants dont le plus âgé a 3 ans et le moins âgé a une année. Aucun de ses enfants ne va à l'école et aucune autre personne n'est en sa charge. Son niveau d'éducation est 6 ans de l'école secondaire.
Il est devenu client d'ACB en 2011. Le cycle actuel lui est le deuxième, et le cycle précedent est remboursé sans aucune irréguralité. Avec le crédit lui donné, il a payé la main d'ouvre des gens qui ont cultivé son champps, acheté 300 kgs des pommes de terre des intrats ainsi que 21 kgs d'angrais chimiques. La difficulté de non remboursement de ce crédit qu'il anticipe est le changement climatique.
Comme stratégie, Monsieur Jean Pierre prévoit accroître son agriculture en achetant un autre champset augmentant les semances. Ceci sera possible avec la demande d'autres prêts dans le futur. Sa stratégie lui permettra d'arriver à son ambition de devenir un grand agriculteur des pommes de terre dans toute la région. Pour sa famille, il a l'ambition de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants quand ils iront à l'école. A part d'être agriculteur des pommes de terre, Monsieur Jean Pierre est éleveur des vaches.
texts.en:
Jean Pierre is a potato farmer. He is a member of the TUGIRUBUKIRE A / Rbv group. He is 31 years old, married, and has two children. His eldest child is three years old, and his youngest child is one year old. None of his children attend school, and he has no other person living in his care. He has six years of secondary school education.

He became a client of ACB in 2011. He is currently in his second loan cycle, after having correctly repaid his first loan. With the loan that he received, he paid the workers who cultivated his fields and bought inputs, 300 kg of potatoes, as well as 21 kg of chemical fertilizer. The difficulty that he foresees in terms of repaying his loan is climate change.

Jean Pierre's strategy is to expand his farming by buying another field and planting more. Doing so will be possible with other loans in the future. His strategy will allow him to achieve his goal of becoming a major potato farmer in the region. With respect to his family, he plans to pay the school fees for his children once they start going to school. Aside from being a potato farmer, Jean Pierre raises cows.

loans.use: to buy 300 kg of potatoes, 21 kg of chemical fertilizers, pay the workers, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells rice at Kajebil near Takoradi. She is married to a farmer and has 3 children. Grace has been selling rice for 8 years now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their rent and utility bills. Grace will use her loan to buy bags of rice to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, she plans to acquire a shop where she can sell her rice.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Agens

texts.en: Agens has operated a grocery shop for some years now. The items in her grocery shop include soap, cooking oil, canned tomatoes, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, and powdered milk. Agens is married with 3 children, and she uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Agens plans to expand her grocery shop.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alpha S.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are primary school teachers from the village of Mabai, in Northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan in order to solve their immediate financial challenges. Some will use their share of the loan to buy a piece of land, others to build a family dwelling house, some will invest in a business, pay school fees for their children, etc. And at the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Alpha is the leader of this group of teachers. The fifty-seven year old is married to a housewife. Alpha has ten children, six of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Alpha has been a professional teacher for thirty five years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like sand, cement, etc. for the construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like sand, cement, etc. for the construction of a family house.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are still in school. 

Beatrice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 55 years old and married with 4 children. She does dairy farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for 20 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. To earn extra income she sells bananas. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen 38 years old. She lives in the Airport area with two of her children, while the other two live with their father. She is single and ended her education in the 9th grade. For the past 10 years, she has been selling soft drinks. She is requesting a loan to buy more soft drinks for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Yei. She sells fish, and has been in business for five years. She is 33 year old, married, and has five children. Two of the children are still in school. 

Grace heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy lives in Air Port areas along with her boyfriend and children. The children are in school and are the ages between 6 and 15. Nancy stopped her education in the 4th grade, and she is now 32 years old. Nancy has been running a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells delicious Liberian dishes. She was taught by her sister on how to run business. Nancy enjoys how the business generates money for her. She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, oil, pepper, onions, and others items for her business. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, pepper, onion, and others items for her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce sells onions at Keygebril near Takoradi. Joyce is a widow. She has 3 children. Joyce has been selling onions for 10 years now. As a single parent, Joyce uses her income to feed, cloth and pay for her children’s school fees.  Joyce will use her loan to purchase bags of onions to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of onions to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in this business for five years. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school. 

Grace heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira and her family are engaged in farming. They breed cows, pigs, and chickens, and they grow grapes, potatoes, onions, garlic, raspberries, haricots, and other crops. Because the volume they produce is not so big, Elmira uses most of their output to support her family. She usually sells only milk and grapes. Sometimes she sells some pork before the New Year holidays when the demand for meat is very high.

Elmira is 43 years old. She lives in Sevkar village, in the Tavuch area. She lives with her husband, her parents-in-law who are pensioners, and two young daughters. In addition to farming, Elmira works at a gas service office as an inspector. 

This is Elmira’s third loan from Nor Horizon. She is requesting a 700,000 AMD loan to buy some piglets and fodder for her farm animals. Elmira always makes her scheduled loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy some piglets and fodder for her farm animals

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en: Johanna is 32 years old, and she lives in the Airport area. She is single and has two children, aged 4 and 8, who are in school and live at home. For the past 16 years she has been selling palm oil in the market. She learned this business from her mother and enjoys the profit she makes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still in school. 

Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is 47 years old. He sells phone accessories to earn a living. He has been in the business for 11 years and has employed 3 people. He describes his business environment as competitive because many people are in the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income, and he hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy phone chargers, batteries, and spare parts to sell.

loans.use: To buy phone chargers, batteries, and spare parts to sell

loans.name: Silina

texts.en:
Silina lives in Yei. She sells fish, and has been in the business for five years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children. Two of the children are still in school. 

Silina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Yei. She sells at a food stall and has been in business for five years. She is 40 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are still in school. 

Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary produces palm kennel oil for sale. She has been in this business for three years now. She lives together with her husband who is an electrician and six dependents. Mary uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Mary will use her loan to purchase palm kennel and palm fruit and produce oil for sale. With the new profit, she will want to buy a machine for the production of her oil.

loans.use: purchase palm kennel and palm fruit to produce oil for sale.

loans.name: Abdul's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are primary school teachers from the village of Massesebeh, in Northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan in order to solve their immediate financial challenges. Some will use their share of the loan to buy a piece of land, others to build a family dwelling house, some will invest in businesses, pay school fees for their children, etc. And at the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Abdul is the leader of this group of teachers. The forty seven years old is a native of Mile-Ninety-One. He is married to a student and the couple has four children – one in primary school and three in secondary. Abdul has been a professional teacher for twenty-five years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 48 years old, married with three children. She does poultry farming to earn a living. Rose has been in the business for three years and describes her business environment as good because she has many regular customers. Since Rose joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy chicks and feed.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feeds.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 58 años  de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, así como también es alegre y amable.  Es conviviente con Enrique quien es jubilado y padre de sus 3 hijos por quienes se han esforzado en salir adelante.  Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos, habitando la casa de su propiedad. El negocio que realiza Elizabeth es la venta de comidas principalmente desayunos y menús para eso cuenta con un local acondicionado en su propia casa donde abrió su restaurante, acondicionando con mesas, sillas y utensilios necesarios para atender muy bien a sus clientes, ya que viendo su zona es transitada considera que tiene demanda y viendo la necesidad económica que tenia en su hogar por la enfermedad de su pareja. 
Se decidió por empezar en éste negocio hace más de 12 años, al comienzo ella sola pero en la actualidad cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable pues comenta que los márgenes de ganancias son muy buenas y la clientela regular que tiene le favorece. Le gusta mucho cocinar, pues aprendió de su madre quien le enseñó los secretos de una buena sazón, con eso espera poder mantener la preferencia y aceptación de sus clientes. Además tiene planes de crecer y en un futuro ampliar su restaurante abriendo una sucursal en alguna zona comercial de la ciudad de Pucallpa, logrando así obtener mayores ingresos. Este será el  préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta estar a gusto con su grupo solidario pues considera a sus integrantes ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas como arroz, aceites y otros; espera poder obtener precios bajos por sus compras al contando y en volumen, pues los precios cada vez suben.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 58, is a hard-working and diligent woman.  She is also cheerful and kind.  She lives with Enrique, who is retired and the father of their three children.  It is for the children that they have made such efforts to get ahead.  She lives with her life partner and their children in their own house.

Elizabeth’s business is selling food, mostly breakfasts and a set menu.  She has a place set up at her own house where she opened her restaurant.  It is set up with tables, chairs, and the utensils needed to tend to her customers very well.  Seeing that her area is busy, she feels that she has demand.  Due to her life partner’s illness, she saw the financial needs that her household had.  She decided to start in this business over 12 years ago.  In the beginning she worked alone, but now she counts on help from her children.

She considers her business to be very profitable.  She says this is because the profit margins are very good, and the regular clientele that she has are to her benefit.  She really likes to cook.  She learned from her mother, who taught her the secrets of good seasoning.  With this she hopes to be able to continue with customer acceptance and being their preference.

Also, she has plans to grow, and in the future she plans to expand her restaurant by opening a branch in a commercial zone in the city of Pucallpa.  This way she will manage to get greater income.

This will be her tenth loan with MFP.  She hopes for your collaboration in order to continue on with her objectives.  She also comments that she is comfortable with her communal bank because she considers the members to be good people.  She will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy ingredients for food preparation.  She will buy things like rice, oil, and others.  She hopes to be able to get low prices for buying for cash and in volume.  This is because prices rise more and more.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and other ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Marcia Griselda

texts.es:
Marcia Griselda tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 13 años de edad, vive en La Lopez, Choloma Cortes.
Marcia se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano. Este negocio lo inicio hace 3 años con la necesidad de generar ingresos para solventar las necesidades de sus hijos siendo ella madre soltera ha tenido que trabajar sola y ha salido adelante. Vende blusas, jeans, short, camisas, sandalias, tenis etc. Su negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa manifestando que le ha ido bien en las ventas. Y con los financiamientos proporcionados por Odef lo ha logrado surtir y mantenerlo estable. Vende todo el día para que sus ventas mejoren.
El préstamo solicitado es el numero 4 y es de 8,000 lempiras que lo invertirá en comprar fardo de Ropa de segunda mano, para mantener surtido el negocio y ofrecer variedad de prendas de vestir.
Su meta es seguir creciendo trabajando mucho para así lograr una solvencia económica para darles a sus hijos la educación necesaria.
texts.en:
Marcia Griselda, 43, is a single mother of two children who are 17 and 13 years old; she lives in La Lopez in Choloma, Cortes.

Marcia sells second hand clothes.  She started the business three years ago needing to generate income to cover her children’s expenses since she’s a single mother and has had to work alone and has gotten ahead.  She sells blouses, jeans, shorts, shirts, sandals, tennis shoes, etc.  Her business is home-based and she states that she’s done well with her sales.  With loans from ODEF she’s been able to stock it and keep it stable.  She sells all day so that sales will improve.

She’s asking for loan #4 in the amount of 8000 lempiras to buy a bundle of second hand clothes to keep her business stocked and offer a variety of clothing items.  Her goal is to continue growing, working hard to attain economic solvency and provide her children with the necessary education.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothes to stock her business.

loans.name: Darlin Karin

texts.es:
Darlin tiene 32 años de edad, casado, vive en un barrio de San Pedro Sula con su esposa y un hijo de 13 años de edad, quien está estudiando.
Desde hace 8 años que Darlin se dedica al comercio y vende mercadería en general, como ser artículos de cocina como ollas, frideras, lociones, ropa y productos de belleza. a este negocio le dedica todo el tiempo necesario. 
El ha hecho crecer el negocio con préstamos de donde obtiene buenas ganancias y las reinvierte. Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo por 20,000.00 Lempiras para surtir de artículos de cocina, sabanas, lociones, cremas, champú, ropa etc. su meta es seguir creciendo y lograr establecer el negocio en un local fijo.
texts.en:
Darlin, 32, is married and lives in a neighborhood in San Pedro Sula with his wife and 13 year old son who is attending school.

For the last 8 years Darlin has been a merchant selling general merchandise like kitchenware, pots, pans, lotions, clothes and beauty products.  He devotes all the time necessary to this business.

He has made the business grow with loans which produce good profits that he reinvests.  He’s currently asking for a 20000 lempira loan to stock up on kitchenware, sheets, lotions, creams, shampoo, clothes, etc.  His goal is to continue growing and manage to open the business in a fixed locale.

loans.use: to buy articles for the home like pots, pans, sheets, lotions and others.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 26 years old, married and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Jesus Salvador

texts.es:
Jesus es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y ofrecer en su negocio una muy buena atención a sus clientes. Casado y con un hijo de 1 año, Jesus es una persona que tiene en su familia un gran apoyo emocional para soportar las largas jornadas de trabajo que su negocio le demanda. En un carro donde prepara churros, Jesus trabaja hace aproximadamente 10 años para generar ingresos con los cuales pueda ofrecer a su familia mejores oportunidades económicas y mejor calidad de vida. Dado el poco capital con el que contaba en el momento de iniciar el negocio Jesus trabaja con un carro alquilado, lo que le representa una desventaja en su negocio para poder obtener mayores utilidades, es por esto que Jesus busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra del carro donde prepara las comidas, el cual es alquilado, y poder así tener mayores utilidades.

Jesus espera que de esta manera pueda tener mayores utilidades de su negocio y su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Además, Jesus sueña con tener un gran negocio y con aprovisionar con un motor su carro, para que de esta manera pueda trabajar más gastando menos tiempo en el transporte de su carro.
texts.en:
Jesús is a person who has always been noted for being very hardworking and for providing very good customer service in his business.  He’s married and has a one year old son.

Jesús is a person whose family provides him with much emotional support to be able to withstand the long work days his business demands.  Jesús has been working for about ten years with a cart making "churros" [deep-fried dough sprinkled with sugar and cinnamon] to generate income with which to offer his family better economic opportunities and better quality of life.  

Because of the little capital he had when he started the business, Jesús has been working with a leased food cart which is a disadvantage for his business to earn higher profits which is why Jesús is looking for a loan that will make it possible for him to buy the cart he uses to prepare his food which he currently leases thus obtaining higher profits.
