El negocio cambiara con el préstamo ya que tendrá más variedad de productos y así venderá más. Las metas de Lesbia es poder sacar a su hijo adelante,  que un día su negocio sea mas grande y productivo y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Es el tercer crédito que solicita en FAMA y ha cumplido puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Lesbia is a member of the El Manantial group; she is 24 years old and the single mother of 1 son who is three years old.  She started out in business in the year 2008 with a small general store.  She opens the business from 7:00 am, and closes it at 8:00 pm.  The advantage she has is that there are no other businesses nearby and she has little competition.  One of the challenges she confronted was that she had to battle with customers who did not pay her on time, but now she only sells in cash and that way avoids losses in her business.

Lesbia requests this loan to invest in the purchase of products such as:  lard, cold cuts, chicken, refreshments, sugar, beans, rice, among others.  The challenges Lesbia faces in her business are due to the fact that food staples are more expensive every day and people aren’t buying like they used to.  The business will change with the loan because she will have a greater variety of products and that way will sell more.  Lesbia’s goals are to help her son get ahead, to make her business larger and more productive one day, and to have a better standard of living.  This is the third loan she requests with FAMA, and she has complied with her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy refreshments, lard, cold cuts and chicken, among other items.

loans.name: Hilda Maricella

texts.es:
HILDA MARICELLA.
Hilda Marisela de 25 años de edad, es soltera, y viaja todos los días a su negocio de mercería, ubicado en el mercado de su localidad, nos cuenta que está solicitando este nuevo crédito porque necesita agrandar su negocio, comprar más productos, ya que hay personas que le piden nuevos estilos, colores y tamaños,(de aretes, anillos, cadenas, bolsas, cosméticos, ganchos para el pelo, diademas, pulseras, colas para el pelo), además quiere comenzar a vender otros estilos de ganchos y aretes que aun no tiene, nos cuenta que el lugar en donde ella vende es muy buen punto para vender ya que es accesible a las personas, también nos cuenta que quiere apoyar con su trabajo a su hermano que todavía está estudiando porque su mama es madre soltera y no puede solventar todos los gastos de su hermanos, además quiere estudiar pero necesita que su hermano termine de estudiar y a si él la va ayudar mientras tanto dice que necesita echarle muchas ganas al trabajo y apoyar a su familia espera no defraudar a la empresa que le ha brindado esta ayuda.
texts.en:
HILDA MARICELLA.
Hilda Marisela is 25 years old. She is single, and travels every day to her accessories business, located in the market in her town. She tells us that she is asking for this new loan because she needs to enlarge her business and buy more products. People are asking her for new styles, colors and sizes (earrings, rings, chains, bags, cosmetics, hair clips, hair bands, bracelets, and hair pieces). She also wants to start selling other types of clips and earrings that she doesn't have yet. She tells us that the place where she sells is a very good spot because it is accessible. She also tells us that with her work she wants to support her brother who is still in school, because her mother is a single mother and can't pay all of her siblings' expenses. She wants to go to school too but she needs for her brother to finish his studies and then he will help her. Meanwhile, she says that she needs to work really hard and support her family. She hopes not to let down the company that is giving her this help.

loans.use: to buy accesories to sell.

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Lansana

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Lansana.  He is married and has 3 children, aged 4, 9 and 13. He has 1 additional dependent, who lives with him to help with the house chores.  In 2000, Lansana established his motorbike spare parts business. He began his business because he wants to be self reliant and to be able to take care of his family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,037,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Lansana has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to increase his stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 407,400. In the future, Lansana plans to open a shop for his wife. The loan shall help increase his profit with huge stock. The market is growing every day so the competition is increasing. He is very grateful to ARD for the loan. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts.

loans.name: Karimu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Karimu from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown in Sierra Leone. He is married with 2 children, age 12 and 16. Karimu's children are currently attending school. 

In 2007, Karimu established his local foodstuff business. He began his business because he grew up in a village where there was no school and no medical center, and he needed to generate income to support his family. He works at his business from 7:30am until 6:00pm, 7 days per week. He says that the main challenges to his business are insufficient capital to operate the business and the high cost of transportation.

Karim requires a loan in order to buy more foodstuff, such as bulgur, green beans, cassava and palm oil. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his children. In the future, he plans to build more shops and expand his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff, such as bulgur, green beans, cassava and palm oil.

loans.name: Duo Sarai Group

texts.es:
DUO SARAI
Teresa  de 42 años de edad, quien es madre de 6 hijos, que gracias a la Bendición de Dios y al esfuerzo, empeño  y dedicación de doña Teresa  ha  podido sostener sola a su familia, doña Teresa desde años atrás se dedico al servicio domestico de casas, al lavado, planchado, con el que ella sostuvo a sus hijos, también realizo el trabajo de venta de pollo destazado el cual cuando la gente la busca aun realiza, pero hace 8 años inicio en la venta de producto ONMILIFE MEDECINA NATURAL con la cual sus ingresos han sido mejor  debido a la demanda de estos productos doña Teresa viaja a varias  aldeas y caseríos del Municipio dando así a conocerse como una buena vendedora.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas productos ONMILIFE(MEDECINA NATURAL)
texts.en:
DUO SARAI

Teresa is 42 years old and the mother of 6 children.  Thanks to God’s blessing and her effort, determination and dedication, Teresa has been able to support her family alone.  Years ago, Teresa worked as a domestic, doing wash and ironing, with which she sustained her children.  She also worked selling quartered chickens that, when people seek her out, she still does.  However, 8 years ago she started selling OMNILIFE NATURAL MEDICINE products, which has generated better income for her given the demand for these products.  Teresa travels to the various towns and hamlets of the Municipality, making herself known as a good salesperson.  She is requesting this loan to buy more OMNILIFE (NATURAL MEDICINE) products.

loans.use: to purchase OMNILIFE (NATURAL MEDICINE) products.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Alfred.  He is married and has 1 child, age 5. In 1992, Alfred established his used caps business. He began his business to be independent and to be able to meet his family's needs. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,151,100 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Alfred has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional used caps. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 414,396. In the future, Alfred plans to build a house and have more children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for used caps.

loans.name: Soliboy

texts.ru: Солибой мужчина сельской местности.Отец пятерых взрослых детей.Жена домохозяйка , занимается домашними делами. Сам работает в колхозе трактористом. Его заработная плата очень низкая, поэтому он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Солибой хочет на полученный кредит купить пару молодых коров и откормив через 10 месяцев продать за хорошую цену.
texts.en: Soliboy lives in a rural area. He is a father of five children, who are now adults. His wife is a homemaker, engaged in running the household. Soliboy works as a tractor operator at a large farm. His salary is very low, and so he also raises livestock for sale. Soliboy would like to use this loan to buy two calves and then re-sell them after fattening them for 10 months.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Osman.  He is married and has 1 child, age 3. In 2002, Osman established his business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Osman has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase the following: Foam Mattress - large size - 10 pieces @ Le360,000, Foam Mattress - small size - 6 pieces @ Le220,000.  The balance, Le80,000, will be added to pay his transport costs. 

In the future, Osman plans to become an international businessman, build a house, buy a car and provide quality education for his child.  This loan will help him to generate more income.  His major challenges are the increase in taxes and some debtors who will not pay on the stipulated date. He is honest and hardworking.  He hopes and prays that he will pay this loan back.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase 16 foam mattresses and pay for their transport.

loans.name: Sherlyn

texts.en: Sherlyn is 55 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin. Sherlyn is single with 1 child. She has a jewelry accessories business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase additional jewelry accessories to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Sherlyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional jewelry accessories to sell.

loans.name: Ma.severa

texts.en: Ma.severa is married with 2 children. She is 54 years old and lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin. She is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers such as inorganic and commercial fertilizers. She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers such as inorganic and commercial fertilizers.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is 48 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. Carmelita has a store that sells groceries.  She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her grocery store. She has been a member of PMPC for almost 1 year.  In the future, Carmelita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Nancy is the coordinator of her group, Jehova es mi Pastor 1 & 2 (God is my pastor). This group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her three children and her long term partner.

Nancy is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in cosmetics, clothing, shoes, and other miscellaneous products.

Nancy will use the profits to reinvest in her business and, through the loan's benefits, give her family a better life, like getting her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy perfume, clothes, cosmetics and miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Unidas Con Cristo 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria, the coordinator of her group Unidas con Cristo (Unite with Christ) 1, 2 & 3, is excited to be taking out her fourth loan. This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to start a business but lacked sufficient capital, so the program went to her community and she invited some neighbors. After almost two years in business, she has been able to expand her enterprise.

Maria plans to use this loan to buy clothing including pants, blouses, shirts, underwear, T-shirts, etc. She will reinvest the profits in her business because during these months, clients are buying a lot for various occasions including Easter and Mother's Day, and she wants to be prepared for the demand.

Maria makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and five of her eight children. She says that her most challenging goal is to acquire her own house. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. She has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Lucy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Milve

texts.en:
Milve is a widow, 47 years of age, who lives in Poblacion, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, together with her two kids. Milve is operating a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 5 years and she earns about 7,000 PHP every month. 

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. Milve's business is very stable in her community. She joined GDMPC in 2009. In the future, she will use her income to support her two kids in their studies until they finish college, and also provide their daily needs. Milve hopes that her business will be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods for her general store.

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en: Ronelyn, a 43-year-old married mother of four, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a shop that sells toys and personal accessories for 10 years. A member of HSPFI since 2009, Ronelyn is requesting a loan for PHP 25,000 to buy stocks of toys and personal accessories. She hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks of toys and personal accessories.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a food shop that sells fruits like apples, watermelon, mangoes & oranges. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy stocks of fruits to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Emelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Hadidja

texts.fr: Madame Hadidja est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et a 4 enfants dont le plus âgé a 13 ans et le moins âgé a 9 mois. Elle n'a aucune autre personne en sa charge. Le cycle actuel est le 3ème pour elle. Les crédits antérieurs sont bien remboursés. Le crédit qu'elle a bénéficié l'a permit de faire réparer sa voiture. Elle a une stratégie d'acheter d'autres voitures qui vont faire entrer des revenus (transport remuneré des personnes). Avec le profit, elle va renforcer les soins médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Hadidja is 30 years old. She is married and has 4 children, aged between 13 years and 9 months. She has no other dependents.

This is Hadidja's 3rd loan cycle. She has correctly repaid her previous loans. The money that she has been given has allowed her to get her car fixed. Her future strategy involves buying more cars which will generate an income by transporting paying passengers. She will use her profits to strengthen her children's healthcare provisions.

loans.use: to have her car repaired.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a display case

loans.name: Junie

texts.en:
Junie is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Junie is providing a motorsikad (motorcycle with side car) with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for these services. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Junie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

loans.name: Yewa

texts.fr:
Yewa est une femme âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée. Elle a 4 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 29 ans et le dernier a 15 ans.
Yewa travaille comme restauratrice depuis 1999. Elle vend de la nourriture pour tous clients devant un collège. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Yewa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du riz, de l’huile, du maïs, des pâtes alimentaires et des tubercules d’ignames pour la restauration. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Yewa voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yewa is 48 years old. She is married and has 4 children, one of whom goes to school. The eldest is 29 years old and the youngest 15.

Yewa has been working as a restaurateur since 1999. She sells food in front of a school, to all types of customers. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. Currently, her main difficulty lies in the fact that she is unable to satisfy all her customers' demands.

Yewa has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy rice, oil, corn, pasta and yam tubers for her restauration business. She wishes to reinvest in her commerce.

In the years ahead, Yewa would like to increase the size of her business. She plans to use her profits to ensure that her family flourishes.

loans.use: to buy cans of oil, rice, pasta products, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married. She is 41 years old and resides in Bañadero, Ozamis City, Philippines. Evangeline owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been 6 years in this business. Each month, she earns about PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more stock, such as shampoo, milk, canned goods, etc. In 2007, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. In the future, she wants to build a house and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as shampoo, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Elena Isabel

texts.es: Elena de 48 años vive ( suburbio Guayaquil )ella empezó a cocer por iniciativa propia . actualmente ella se didica a se costurera con tres maquinas que tiene le va bien. Es unida su esposo es mecanico  tiene 5 hijos mayores y menores . trabaja todos los días sola. a futuro ella anhela tener mas maquinas y que sus hijos sean profesionales. Con el préstamo comprara (  materia prima )
texts.en: Elena is 48 and lives in a suburb of Guayaquil.  She learned sewing on her own and now does so successfully using three machines.  She lives with her husband, who works as a mechanic, and their 5 children.  She works every day on her own and in the future she hopes to buy additional sewing machines, and hopes to see her children become profesionals. With this loan she will buy sewing materials.

loans.use: cloth, thread, sewing machine.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 3 children. She has a food/retail shop or sari-sari (variety) store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, beverages & personal accessories to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, beverages & personal accessories to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 3 children. Jennifer has a food/retail shop or sari-sari (variety) store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Jennifer hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Diyaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 23-year-old client. He is married lives with five family members who three of them work.

Diyaa has been the owner of a painting shop since 2010. He sells all types and colors of paints. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a 1,200 USD as youth loan in order to renovate his shop. He hopes to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his painting shop.

loans.name: Oscar Trinidad

texts.es: Oscar es pequeño productor de la zona, aprendio este trabajo gracias a sus padres que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, gracias a una pequeña parcela que le dieron como herencia se desarrolla como productor, tierra que ha sabido cuidar y aprovechar ya que estan en buenas condiciones para la crianza de ternero desarrollo; esta solicitando su 7mo credito para continuar con su negocio de compra y venta de ganado, pues los compra pequeños para engordarlos y desarrollarlos para posteriormente venderlos a un buen precio obteniendo ganancias que le permiten mejorar poco a poco su nivel de vida; y se siente agradecido por la oportunidad que kiva le ha brindado pues anteriormente le apoyo con un credito para compra de ganado de desarrollo.
texts.en: Oscar is a small local grower, and learned how to work the land from his parents.  Thanks to a small plot that he inherited, he cares for livestock, and his land is well-suited for raising calves.  He now a seventh credit to continue to grow his business: buying and selling cattle; he buys them young and raises them fit and healthy to sell at a good price.  This allows him income to improve his living standards.  He is grateful for the opportunity Kiva has given him for credit to buy livestock.

loans.use: To buy breeding calves

loans.name: Sargwl

texts.en:
Sargwl is a 27-year-old Iraqi woman. She has one child whom she has been raising alone since her divorce.

Working from home, she has been using her sewing skills for the past four years to bring in the necessary income for the household, herself and her child. 

Because Sargwl is under 30, she qualifies for a 'youth loan'. Sarwl took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 1,200 US Dollars (USD) to purchase an overlock sewing machine, fabric, and other raw materials to be able to better meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine, fabric, and other raw materials.

loans.name: Nadjo

texts.fr:
Nadjo est un homme âgé de 26 ans. Il est marié å une commerçante. Il a 3 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 8 ans et le dernier a 7 mois.
Nadjo travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il vend des prêts à porter pour tous clients au marché. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Nadjo a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des prêts à porter. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Nadjo voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit d’assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Nadjo is 26 years old and is married to a saleswoman. He has 3 children aged between 7 months and 8 years, one of whom goes to school.

Nadjo has been working as a reseller since 2010. He sells ready-to-wear clothing at the market, to all sorts of customers. He gets his merchandise in Lomé and works alone. Right now, his principal problem is his insufficient inventory.

Nadjo has requested his 1st loan from WAGES in order to buy some ready-to-wear clothing. He wishes to reinvest in his business.

Nadjo wishes to increase the size of his business in the years ahead. He plans to use his profits to make sure that his family can flourish.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Julia Patricia

texts.es: Julia de  26 años vive (machala ecuador) . ella decidió entrar al negocio de  vender cosas de reciclaje por su familia . no tenia en que trabajar i decidió entarar a este negocio. Trabaja todos los días solo 4 horas con mucho esfuerzo y ganas . la dificultad es el clima . a futro ella anhela tener una empresa de reciclaje y que DIOS le de salud y vida . con el préstamo comprara ( cobre )
texts.en: Julia is 26 and lives in Machala, Ecuador.  She decided to sell recycled items to help her family, since she was not previously working.  She works hard every day for four hours, in a difficult climate.  She hopes in the future to have her own recycling business and that she will be blessed with health and life.  With this loan, she will buy copper.

loans.use: to buy copper and aluminum

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 
Elsa has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 17,000 to buy additional stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Elsa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Alma has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Alma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 2 children. 
Letecia has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 to buy additional stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Letecia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Letecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Cruz Bolivar

texts.es: Cruz de 60 años vive ( duran ecuador ).el decidió hacer expreso por que el es chofer profesional. De esa manera el ingresa una buena situación económica para su familia.trabaja todos los días solo a futuro el anhela tener un auto nuevo. Con el préstamo comprara( mantenimiento para el vehiculo)
texts.en: Cruz is 60 and lives in Duran, Ecuador.  Since he is a professional driver, he decided to run a transport business. In this way, he improves his family's economic situation.  He works every day on his own and hopes to buy a new car.  With this credit, he will perform maintainence on his vehicle.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Elenita has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy additional stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Elenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2008  In the future, Elenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle a 2 enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 18 ans et le dernier a 12 ans.
Yawa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2002. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Yawa a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Yawa voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité et diversifier les articles. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawa is 30 years old. She has 2 children who both go to school. The eldest is 18 years old and the youngest 12.

Yawa has been working as a reseller since 2002. She sells grocery products door-to-door to all sorts of customers. She works alone and gets her supplies in Lomé. Right now, her main difficult is her lack of sufficient stock.

Yawa has requested her 2nd loan from WAGES in order to buy grocery products. She wishes to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, she would like to increase the size of her business and diversify her product range. She plans to use her profits to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Ricardo Luciano

texts.es: Ricardo de 54 años vive ( milagro ecuador ). El desde muy pequeño fue aprendiendo para que ahora que es adulto poner su propio taller de mecánica. lo hizo y le va muy bien en su negocio. El trabaja de lunes a sabado solo . la dificultad que el tiene es la lluvia por las inundaciones . a futuro el anhela tener un taller de mecánica bien establecido y terminar su casa . con el préstamo comprara (vitrinas herramientas ).
texts.en: Ricardo is 54 and lives in Milagro, Ecuador.  From an early age he learned skills to open a mechanic shop and his business is doing very well.  He works from Monday to Saturday and the main difficulty he faces is from rains and flooding.  He hopes to grow his business in the future and finish building his home.  With this loan he will buy tools.

loans.use: to buy tools and oil.

loans.name: Rosa Beatriz

texts.es: Eliana de 23 años vive ( Portoviejo Ecuador ). Ella decidió entrar a este negocio por una amiga porque ella le alludava a vender. . gracias a su amiga decidió independizarce y su situación económica mejoro  le va bien. Trabaja todos los días con muchas ganas y esfuerzo sola . a futuro ella anhela  incrementar su negocio . con el préstamo comprara (productos de Yambal vitrinas ).
texts.en: Eliana is 23 and lives in Portoviejo, Ecuador.  She decided to start her business after a friend who helped her begin her sales.  She is now independent and in a better economic situation.  She works hard and on her own every day, and hopes in the future to grow her business.  With this credit she plans to buy Yambal merchandise.

loans.use: perfumes and lotions

loans.name: Myrlinda

texts.en:
Myrlinda is a 40-year-old single woman. She lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where her wide array of corn production is located. She has been cultivating this land since she was 34 years old. She doesn't mind the scratches and itches brought by these type of plants, as long as she can earn income.

She normally receives PHP 3,000 a month from her farming. In 2010, Myrlinda joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase manure to increase production. When the crop gets harvested, the revenue will be allotted to expanding the business area, so she can earn a higher income to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Renny

texts.en:
Renny is 25 years old and has a 2-year-old child.  He is a young entrepreneur from San Miguel, Bohol. 

Renny is a fish vendor and ice cream seller.  He also buys and resells scrap like plastic, glass bottles and metal.  Renny works hard to save for his child's education.  He requested this loan to buy more scrap to sell.  Renny hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more scrap for resale

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 35 years old and is a married man with 3 children ages 7, 10 and 12.  He runs a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol.  Roberto sells various items like toiletries, snacks and canned goods in his store.  Roberto also raises pigs to help augment his income.  He works hard to provide for his family's daily needs and to send his children to school. 

Roberto has requested a loan to buy pig feed and more items to sell such as canned goods and ice.  This loan will help increase Roberto's business profitability.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and more items to sell such as canned goods and ice

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. He is a widower with 6 children ages between 7 and 20.

Santiago has been in the rice farming business for 7 years.  He earns about 3000 PHP per month doing this farming.  Santiago works hard to improve his earnings and be able to sustain his children.  He requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Santiago hopes to achieve an abundant harvest and a better income. He plans to pay for his children's school fees with his extra income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Hodohalo

texts.fr:
Hodohalo est une femme âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée å un enseignant. Elle n’a pas d’enfants.
Hodohalo travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle vend de la boisson locale pour tous  clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Hodohalo a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du mil pour la préparation de la boisson locale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et épargner une partie des profits réalisés.
Dans les prochaines années, Hodohalo voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Hodohalo is 34 years old. She is married to a teacher and has no children.

Hodohalo has been working as a reseller since 2009. She sells local beverages door-to-door to all types of customers. She buys her products in Lomé and works alone. Her current problem is that she is unable to satisfy all of the demands of her customers.

Hodohalo has requested her 2nd loan from WAGES in order to buy the millet she needs to prepare the local beverage. She would like to reinvest in her business and save some of the profits she earns.

In the coming years, Hodohalo would like to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy millet.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 37 years old and married with 2 children.

Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for sale her store.

Elsie has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Elsie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell at the store

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona, 42 years old and a married woman, has three daughters and a son. She has been in the embroidery business for almost 10 years now, but kept it as a home-business. She does embroidery on traditional dresses, table cloths, etc.

She has applied for this loan to buy more colorful thread and fabric to make more embroidery items such as pillows.

loans.use: to buy more colorful thread and fabric

loans.name: Ma. Melanie

texts.en:
Ma. Melanie is 45 years old and married with 9 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ma. Melanie is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.  Ma. Melanie has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is, to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Edwige Chantal

texts.fr: Agée de 35ans, Edwige Chantal vit en location avec son mari et ses trois enfants. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente des pagnes et bazins. Elle a son fonds de commerce dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Expérimentée dans le domaine de crédit, elle sollicite et obtient un micro-crédit auprès de Finadev en vue de renforcer son stock et d'en tirer d'énorme profits pour le bonheur de la famille.
texts.en:
Edwige Chantal is 35 years old and lives in rented accommodation with her husband and 3 children. She specialises in the retail of pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African sarong-like clothing) and damask fabrics. She runs her business in one of Benin's markets.

Experienced in the area of credit, Edwige Chantal has requested and received a micro-credit loan from Finadev in order to strengthen her inventory and earn large profits with which to make her family happy.

loans.use: to buy 15 pagnes and 8 rolls of damask fabric of mixed quality.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Laila, 46 years old and a married woman, has a son who is 22 years old now. She has been running a tailoring and embroidery business for a while, and recently she started making baby diapers to sell. 

Now she has applied for this loan to buy more machines that will allow her to start making tissues, too.

loans.use: to buy more machines for making tissues

loans.name: Santos Rosas De Lima

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Santos Rosas De Lima le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior e interior. Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar el material que le esta haciendo falta que es cemento, arena, pintura del exterior e interior, ya que no cuenta con el dinero para comprar el material. 
Don Santos Rosas De Lima se encargar de realizar la mejorar en horario adicional a su empleo, que tiene  de guardia de seguridad de una compañía. 
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su familia y protegerlos de enfermedades.
texts.en: Santos Rosas De Lima's house requires exterior and interior finishing.  He seeks credit to buy materials needed to finish the house, such as cement, sand and exterior and interior paint, as he has not been able to purchase these materials.   Don Santos Rosas De Lima plans to work additional hours at his job, where he is a private security guard.  He hopes to provide for his family and keep them healthy.

loans.use: to finish the exterior and interior of his home

loans.name: Eid

texts.en: Eid, 59 years old and a married man, has four sons and two daughters. After his retirement from the military, he opened a shop selling fruit and vegetables. It has been two years since he started his business. Now Eid is applying for this loan so he can fill his store with more seasonal fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: to fill the store with seasonal fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled, 21 years old and a single guy, lives with his mother along with his seven brothers and one sister. 

After their father passed away, it was time for the guys to start working together and help each other to support the whole family. One of them is Khaled who opened a shoe and clothes shop in the market and has been managing it for two years now. He has applied for this loan to bring in a new spring selection of clothes.

loans.use: to bring in a new spring selection of clothes

loans.name: Tojiboy

texts.ru: Тожибой мужчина 40 лет,женат,имеет троих детей.Он очень трудолюбивый,ответственный человек.Уже 12 лет занимается откормом скота а также каждый год выращивает овес и пшеницу.Он очень любит лошадей и его лошади считаются самыми лучшими лошадьми среди населения.А его жена помогает по откорму скота и реализует кисломолочные продукты.А его дети помогают в выращиванию сельхоз культур.На полученный займ он хочет закупить скот.Он надеется на вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Tojiboy is a 40 years old man, he is married and has three children. He is a very hard working and responsible man. He has been engaged in fattening of cattle for 12 years already, and he also grows oats and wheat every year. 

Tojiboy loves horses very much and his horses are counted as the very best among the population. His wife helps him in the fattening of cattle and she sells dairy products. His children help with growing crops. 

He wants to buy cattle for the loan. He hopes for your help.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Eliana Elizabeth

texts.es: Eliana de 23 años vive ( Portoviejo Ecuador ). Ella decidió entrar a este negocio por una prima que la incentivo diciéndole que era bueno y a la gente le gusta . gracias a ese impulso mejoro su situación económica y le va bien. Trabaja todos los días con muchas ganas y esfuerzo sola . aparte hace trabajos de belleza . es casada tiene 1 hijo y su esposo es repartidor de diarios . a futuro ella anhela tener su gabinete en su domicilio y incrementar su negocio . con el préstamo comprara (productos de Yambal vitrinas ).
texts.en:
Eliana, 23, lives in Portoviejo, Ecuador.  She decided to go into this business because a cousin encouraged her, telling her it was good and people like it.  Thanks to this impulse she improved her economic situation, and it is going well for her.  She works alone every day with a lot of desire and effort.  She does beauty treatments as well.  She is married and has one child, and her husband delivers newspapers.  In the future she wants to have her cabinet in her house and expand her business.

With the loan she will buy Yanbal products and display cases.

loans.use: to buy personal products and a display case.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 63 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 11 years, Zenaida has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from raising pigs and selling rice. She has borrowed and repaid 19 previous loans from NWTF.

Zenaida is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa de 45 años vive ( paraíso Guayaquil ). Ella aprendió desde muy pequeña el oficio de ser costurera. Y lo puso en practica por el motivo de que su esposo la abandono  a ella y a sus hijos. Trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación todos los días . a futuro ella anhela incrementar su taller. Con el préstamo comprara ( material de costura como telas, maquina de coser).
texts.en:
Rosa, 45, lives in Paraíso, Guayaquil.  She learned the job of being a seamstress from a very young age.  She put it into practice because her husband abandoned her and her children.  She works with a lot of effort and dedication every day.  In the future she wants to expand her workshop.

With the loan she will buy sewing materials such as fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Using the previous loan and participating in many crafts exhibitions and markets have helped Randa to enlarge the business and add more products. She now makes more accessories from different shapes and colors of beads, knits clothes, makes straw baskets and frames, and recently she has been recycling newspapers to make different shapes of decoration pieces.

She has applied for this loan now to expand her business and look for a good shop where she can show and sell her hand-made crafts.

loans.use: to expand her business and look for a good shop to display her crafts.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is married and has six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorena is 53 years old and has one child who is in school.

Lorena has a dried-fish-vending business in the Philippines. Lorena has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Lorena has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 49 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Norma works very hard to provide for her family.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Norma has been in this business for one year. She sells a variety of items such as eggs, soft drinks, sardines, spices, etc.

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lutfia

texts.en:
Lutfia is a 49-year-old married woman. She has no children.
 
Lutfia opened a shop for selling fruits and vegetables last year. It was limited to a few types only. Now she has applied for this loan in order to fill the shop with more kinds of fruits and vegetables to increase her revenue.

loans.use: to fill the shop with more kinds of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 55 years old and married with three children ages 13, 16 and 18. Her husband works as a farmer. Teofila is also a farmer and she works with her husband to cultivate their land and plant rice. She also rents a stall at the market to sell their produce. Teofila does her best to take care of her family and provide for their needs. 

Teofila is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 51 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past eight years, Ma. Victoria has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from raising pigs. Ma. Victoria has borrowed and repaid 28 previous loans from NWTF.

Ma. Victoria is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn works hard to support her family. Arlyn is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Arlyn has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Arlyn has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.ru: Мушараф замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Муж является трудовым мигрантом. Более 4-х лет она занимается купле- продажей кураги, абрикоса и его зерен. С прибыли и дополнительного дохода, получаемых от сыновей находящихся в Российской Федерации на заработках, она купила автомашину марки «Опель» для своего бизнеса. Мушараф запрашивает займ для покупки сухофруктов и аппарата для очищения миндальных косточек.
texts.en:
Musharaf is married and the loving mother of three children. Her husband is a migrant worker. She has been engaged in buying and selling dried and fresh apricots and its grains. She bought an "Opel" car for her business, using her profits and additional income that she received from her sons who are migrant workers in the Russian Federation.

Musharaf requests a loan for the purchase of dried fruits and an apparatus for the cleaning of almond kernels.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits and an apparatus for the cleaning of almond kernels

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is a 37-year-old married lady. She has four children. Her husband works as a driver and he sells chicken too.

For the last two years, Zakia has been selling clothes at home. She has applied for this loan to prepare for the upcoming seasons and bring in some spring and summer collections.

loans.use: to bring in some spring and summer clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is originally from Ibb, Yemen, and is 37 years old.

He has been fixing ovens since he was 12 years old. He finished his high school degree. He was a worker in this field in another oven shop until he acquired more experience, and then he became independent. 

This has been his main business and it is profitable. He does not have any other source of income. He would like to boost his business by acquiring materials for fixing ovens in order to allow him to respond more effectively to the requirements of his customers. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.

He reckons that this loan will help because it will enable him to get more profitable prices.

Ibrahim's future plans are to better stock his business by buying more materials and to build a house where he can work without having to rent a separate space.

loans.use: to buy materials for fixing ovens.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 44 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, she has run a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines and she also earns an income from selling food. Josie has borrowed and repaid nine previous loans through NWTF.

Josie is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She aspires to save money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell

loans.name: Iries

texts.en:
Iries is married and runs a fishing and fish-selling business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family and has been in this business for the past four years. 

Iries is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials to repair her fishing boat. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business and secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her boat

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 52 years old and married with six children.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Elvira has borrowed and paid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years. She also earns an income from rice farming and food vending.

Elvira aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Emerlyn

texts.en:
Emerlyn is 31 years old and has two children. 

Emerlyn is in the agricultural business and raises pigs in the Philippines. Emerlyn has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Emerlyn has been raising pigs for eight years now. She has borrowed 33 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Emerlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Lita

texts.en:
Maria Lita is 47 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For the past three years, Maria Lita has run a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Maria Lita is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase materials for her fishing business. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en:
Ameen is a 34-year-old married man, and he is the father of three children. He is sacrificing his whole life for their happiness and success. He lives in Aden, Yemen. 

He has been running an electrical shop. He has a good relationship with all of his customers. He started his business with a small amount of capital that allowed him to open his business.

Due to bad situations in Yemen, he couldn't stock his business with electrical parts. So he is applying  for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy electrical parts like lamps, wires, screwdrivers and fans, since his clientele is increasing. 

Ameen hopes to continue improving his business and pleasing his customers.

loans.use: to buy electrical parts like lamps, wires, screwdrivers and fans for his business.

loans.name: Dinnes

texts.en:
Dinnes is 49 years old and single. He is lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the past five years, he has sold soft drinks in his local community. Dinnes earns 3,000 PHP each month. He joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation.

Dinnes is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan to purchase more soft drinks to sell. In the future, he hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family and has operated her business for seven years. 

Josie is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 63 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past eight years, Lolita has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from rice farming. She has borrowed and repaid 25 previous loans through NWTF.

Lolita is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. She aspires aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es: Jose de 45 años vive ( portoviejo ecuador ). El decidió escoger este negocio que es la venta de  periódicos porque el se dio cuenta que era bueno. Y era una buena manera dde trabajar dignamente y de salir adelante con su familia. Trabaja todos los días con muchas ganas de  6: 00a 12:00. A futuro el anhela darle un mejor  futuro con la ayuda de DIOS. Con el préstamo comprara ( extra super tales como revistas, periodicos)
texts.en:
José, 45, lives in Portoviejo, Ecuador.  He decided to choose this business selling newspapers because he realized that it was good.  Also, it was a good way to work with dignity and to get ahead with his family.  He works every day with a lot of desire from 6:00 a.m. until 12:00.  In the future he wants to give a better future, with the help of God.

With the loan he will buy additional things such as magazines and newspapers.

loans.use: to buy magazines and newspapers.

loans.name: Asam

texts.en:
Asam is a 34-year-old man. He is married and doesn't have children. He lives in Aden, Yemen.

He has been operating a barber shop for five years. He employees three workers to help him in his shop. It is a profitable project, and now he wants to improve his work conditions by moving to another shop and renewing his barber kit.

He is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to help him cover the expenses needed to move to another shop. These preparations include installing new shelves and installing mirrors and lights. This will improve Asam's barber shop and will satisfy his customers and increase the family's income. 

In the future, he hopes to have children and to educate them at schools. In addition, he wants to purchase another barber kit to improve his work.

loans.use: to buy and install new shelves, mirrors and lights.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years and also earns an income from rice farming. Evelyn has sustained her business through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. 

Evelyn is requesting a 23,000 PHP  loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other equipment for her business. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and equipment to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: As a married parent of 8 children, Merlinda works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and making nipa. Merlinda is borrowing 11,500 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Resurecion

texts.en:
Resurecion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a shell crafts making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her shell crafts business. Resurecion has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport and farming rice.

Resurecion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Selma

texts.en:
Selma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fruits to sell. Selma has been in this business for 10 years. Selma earns additional income from buying and selling coconuts.

Selma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is from Panta-on, Ozamiz City. She is 37 years old. Jocelyn is married and has three children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for 16 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for family needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a conservative person, so she asked her husband, who works with her, to take her place in the photo.

Raeda, is a 37-year-old married lady who has six sons and daughters.
 
Raeda and her husband started a small business from home selling cleaning detergents and home products. Then they opened a store for selling home tools and some tools that are used in building and fixing, etc.

Now Raeda wants to expand their business and open a section for selling home products. For that she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to expand her store to add home products.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 67 years old and married with 9 children. Aida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Aida has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 27 years and also earns an income from fish and food vending.

Aida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Don Carlos tiene 40 años de edad, está soltero, tiene 5 hijos de 10, 16, 18 y 22 años de edad, con quienes vive en Siguatepeque.
El tiene aproximadamente 3 años de dedicarse a su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de ladrillos de construcción de todo tamaño, quien adquirió mucha experiencia donde trabajaba.
Las ventas las realiza de acuerdo a los pedidos que le hacen las empresas o particulares para la construcción. El trabaja en esta actividad todo el día.
Es el primer préstamo que solicita por 4,000.00 Lempiras y lo va invertir en abastecimiento de materia prima como ser (tierra y leña para el horno), que utilizara para la elaboración de los ladrillos.
Sus planes son crecer en el negocio para obtener ingresos y darle un mejor sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 40 years old and single.  He has five children, ages 10, 16, 18, and 22.  He lives with his children in Siguatepeque.

For approximately three years he has been devoting himself to his own business.  He sells bricks of all sizes for construction.  He acquired a lot of experience where he used to work.

He makes his sales of bricks for construction according to the orders made by companies or private individuals.

This is his first loan, and he is requesting 4,000 lempiras.  He will use the loan to stock up on raw materials like soil and firewood for the furnace.  He will use these materials to make the bricks.

His plans are to grow in the business in order to get income and to give his family better support.

loans.use: to buy supplies like soil and firewood in order to make bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for her business.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Don Julio, habita junto a su familia en su pequeña finca llamada el Bambu, la cual  presenta buenas condiciones tècnicas para el desarrollo de su actividades ganaderas y agricolas, ademas tiene 4 mzs de àrea compacta de cultivo de cacao, donde tiene producciòn periodica durante el mes. Julio solicita su 1er crèdito para el establecimiento de pasto con el objetivo de garantizar la alimentaciòn de su hato ganadero en tiempo de verano.  Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, lider en la comunidad, responsable, con deseo de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Julio lives with his family in his small farm called El Bambu, which has good technical conditions for developing his cattle and farming activities. He also has four manzanas [approximately seven acres] of cacao crop, where he has regular production during the month. 

Julio is seeking his 1st loan to set up a pasture with the aim of guaranteeing food for his herd of cattle in the summer. He would describe himself as a hard-worker, a leader in the community, responsible and wanting to get ahead.

loans.use: to set up a pasture.

loans.name: San Vicente  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Vicente está formado por 21 socias, quienes se caracterizan por ser mujeres de un gran carisma, amables y gentiles, se dedican a laborar en la agricultura, ganadería, al bordado y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, mantienen siempre la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Victoria del Portete, que se encuentra localizada al sur de la ciudad Cuenca, lleva su nombre en honor a la batalla ocurrida en sus campos, precisamente en las faldas del Portete, el 27 de Febrero de 1829. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Elvia, tiene 32 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 15, 14, 12 y 11 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en la escuela. Su esposo labora en la área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia siendo el sacrifico del trabajo conyugal.

Doña María Elvia se dedica al bordado, actividad que aprendió trabajando desde hace 7 años y ahora es un negocio que lo realiza desde su casa y trabaja bajo pedido. También cría cuyes, gallinas, vacas y borregos los que los vende en su comunidad.
 
Es miembro de la banca comunal hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando cuyes y pollos.

Su meta es agrandar su casa.

En la foto se encuenrtra una hija de una socia quien esta a lado de la pizarra con buso negro con cordones blancos.
texts.en:
The San Vicente communal bank has 21 members, all of whom are highly charismatic, kind, and pleasant. They work in agriculture, livestock, and  embroidery, and many of them work in the city in various jobs. They continue to maintain the culture and tradition of their people. They live on the outskirts of the Victoria del Portete parish, which is south of Cuenca city. Their bank name is in honour of the battle that occurred there, on the hillsides of Portete, on February 27, 1829.
One of the group members is Señora María Elvia. She is 32, and married with four children ages 15, 14, 12 and 11. Her two eldest children are in high school, and her two youngest are in elementary school. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. They own their own home thanks to their combined hard work.
Maria Elvia embroiders. She learned this work seven years ago and now runs this business from her home, based on orders. She also raises guinea pigs, hens, cows, and sheep, which she sells in her community.
She has been a member of the communal bank for four years. She will invest this new loan in the purchase of guinea pigs and chickens.
Her goal is to expand her home.
In the photo, a daughter of one of the members is seen standing next to the blackboard, wearing the black shirt that has white laces.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Sotero

texts.es: Don Sotero es dueño de una pequeña parcela ubicada a borde de carretera, con buenas infraestructura, en la  requiere su 2do crédito con AFODENIC, para realizar el establecimiento de pasto mejorado, para garantizar la alimentación de su hato ganadero en temporada de verano,cuenta con su propio inventario ganadero,obteniendo sus ingresos economicos de  de la producción de su finca, como es el establecimiento de raices y tuberculos, granos bàsicos, tiene experiencia en sus actividades que desarrolla en su finca, en compañia del nùcleo familiar,  y se caracteriza por ser un señor cumplido con buen record, de buena conducta, trabajador, esta agradecido con la institución por la oportunidad que le han brindado de mejorar sus condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en: Don Sotero owns a small parcel of land on the edge of the highway. There is good infrastructure there. For his lands, he needs a second loan with AFODENIC in order to improve his pasture. This will guarantee the nourishment of his livestock for the summer. He has his own livestock and makes an income from his farm's production. He farms roots and tubers and basic grains. He and his family work the farm. Sotero is a man with a good record who makes good on his obligations. He carries himself well and is a hard worker. Sotero is grateful to the institution for this opportunity to improve his family's conditions.

loans.use: to improve his pastures.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 65 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a little general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Angelita has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, liqueur, etc.

In the future Angelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia works hard to support her family. Cecelia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Cecelia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. She has been in this business for 35 years now.

In the future, Cecelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Concordia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell. She has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Concordia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business. Cristina has been in this business for 8 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Delia works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Delia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 51 years old, married, and has one child. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Angelita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Angelita has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Angelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Diocenciana

texts.en:
Diocenciana is 49 years old, married, and has one child. Diocenciana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Diocenciana has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Diocenciana aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda is 50 years old and married. She has four children. Elda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Elda has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retail business for four years and also earns an income from food vending, raising pigs and running a general store.

Elda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Reneda

texts.en:
Reneda is from Ozamiz City. She is 56 years old. Reneda is married and has 8 children. To make a living, Reneda raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from coconut production. Reneda has been engaged in her business for 6 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

In 2005, Reneda joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Reneda is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the cost of maintenance of the farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of maintenance of the farm.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Erma requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials for her business. She has been in this business for 28 years now.

In the future, Erma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 56 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Evelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like fishing nets for her business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials like fishing nets for her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a "carinderia" (eatery) business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her carinderia/eatery business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 6 years now. In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her "carinderia" (eatery) business

loans.name: Letresita

texts.en:
Letresita is 45 years old. She is married and has 3 children who are in school.

Letresita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Letresita has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 11 times, in the past, from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Letresita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ada Lila

texts.es:
Ada Lila tiene 24 años de edad, es casada  hace 4 años su esposo trabaja como taxista y tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 1 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de la Ceiba, Atlántida.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora se gana la vida vendiendo ropa Nueva. Vende todo tipo de ropa camisas, pantalones, short, ropa interior para dama. Lo estableció hace 3 años con la idea de mejorar su calidad de vida y  trabajar en lo propio.  Con las ganancias y los financiamientos a logrado superarse y su negocio se mantiene estable y también logro comprar un taxi. Cuenta con muchos clientes y vende su mercadería en su casa y en ocasiones lo hace de manera ambulante. Trabajando de 9.00 am a 5.00 pm.
Solicita su 3 préstamo de 12,000 lempiras para invertirlo en comprar ropa de la temporada, (short, camisetas y sandalias.) aprovechando la temporada del verano. Espera que con esta inversión puedan mejorar sus ingresos.
Su meta es consolidar su negocio , hacerle mejoras a su vivienda, construir el cerco del solar y que sus hijas tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
Ada Lila is 24 years old, and she has been married for four years.  Her husband works as a taxi driver, and she has two children, ages three and one.  She lives in the city of Ceiba, Atlantida.

She is a very hard-working woman who earns her living selling new clothes.  She sells all types of clothes like shirts, pants, shorts, and women’s underwear.  She established her business three years ago with the thought of improving her quality of life and working on her own.

With her earnings and the loans she has managed to improve herself, and she keeps her business stable.  She also managed to buy a taxi.  She has a lot of customers, and she sells her merchandise at her house.  She sometimes sells in an itinerant manner, and she works from 9:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

She is requesting her third loan for 12,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy seasonal clothing (shorts, t-shirts, and sandals).  She will be taking advantage of the summer season.  She hopes that with this investment she will be able to improve her income.

Her goals are to strengthen her business, make improvements to her house, build a solar powered fence, and for her children to have a good education.

loans.use: to buy new clothes (shorts, t-shirts, and sandals) to take advantage of the summer season.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ophelia has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Ophelia has been in this business for 8 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Rosalita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosalita has been in this business for 30 years now. In the future, Rosalita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old and married. She has one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for the family.

Maricel runs a soft drinks dealership in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. She has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, beer etc.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married and has 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 40 years old and 2 of her children are in school.
